attributes.action: Consider upping the drinking age to 21
attributes.background: This is to tackle the booze culture in this country where young people go out at weekends, get absolutely wasted and then have fights at 3am in the streets.
attributes.additional_details: Most people do like to return to a local pub culture and away from the thousands of bars that only serve to get people as drunk as possible. Also, It would still be a good idea to revert drinking hours back to what we had previously with traditional last orders closing times. After all, it's necessary to manage this problem that we are having in this country. With threatening refugee crisis, it's becoming more and more dangerous to stand by all soft laws should we protect our citizens. Do it now

attributes.action: Change the NLA guidelines to allow mobile workers to be paid for travel.
attributes.background: In September 2015 the CJEU ruled that the time spent by mobile workers - that is, those who have no fixed place of work - travelling between home and their first and last place of work each day counts as 'working time' under the WTD and WTR. However payment for these hours is down to national law.
attributes.additional_details: National law in this case is the NLA formely the National Minimum Wage which states that travel time between home and a place of work is excluded from the obligation to pay the NMW, including for mobile workers. This is unfair and mind boggling considering that a court has ruled that travel time under the WTD and WTR that safeguard workers to make sure they have regulated breaks and rest periods as work but does not govern pay for these hours. I therefore would like this to be addressed.

attributes.action: I would like you to debate security on all schools in the uk
attributes.background: The Jewish community have now put security In their schools and neighbourhood. This must be a very big concern to take such action. This is the world we live in now........

attributes.action: Give More benefits and income allowance for single parents In higher education
attributes.background: Single parent families are not given enough support or income to gain qualifications for highly paid employment to surpport their children and make a better and secure future for them selves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance grants replaced with Maintenon loans 
Denied housing benefit if return to full time higher education 
Lack of support for child care

attributes.action: Make the hosting and running of revenge porn sites a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Although its illegal to upload the photos to the site the hosting and running of the sites isn't illegal meaning nude photos can be viewed by thousands without the owners consent.  This can also lead to vulgar, demoralizing comments.
attributes.additional_details: Anna Richardson did an hour long documentry titled 'revenge porn' where she interviews victims and perpertrators of the revenge porn community.

attributes.action: Make video recording of hearings in Courts and Employment Tribunals mandatory.
attributes.background: At present, litigants-in-person and certain groups receive hostile and unfair treatment in Courts and Tribunals. Employment tribunals do not record proceedings. Voice recordings in Courts are edited before being released. The system makes perjury possible and perversity in decisions unchallengeable.

attributes.action: To allow the wife of veteran of ex-soldier Andrew McLaughlin, to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Andrew McLaughlin has an American wife and a 2-year old daughter and they have been denied entry into the UK because of the Government's strict laws on the rights of non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details: Andrew is a former soldier with the Grenadier Guards who served in Afghanistan from March to September 2012. He is from Warwickshire and is a lifelong Aston Villa fan. He married his American wife Wanda in December 2011 and they have a 2-year old daughter who have been refused entry to the UK because of his low income.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly £580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: We demand reform to the honours system to re-establish public trust
attributes.background: Honours nominations by the Prime Minister which are viewed as rewarding (i) financial donations to his/her party or (ii) private service to the Prime Minister and his/her close associates are corrosive of public trust in the political system.
attributes.additional_details: We demand reform of the honours system so that it reflects genuine public service and outstanding achievement as it is meant to do. The current honours committee structure is clearly not robust enough to achieve this. We demand democratic accountability of honours recommendations by the Prime Minister to be strengthened such that they can be scrutinised and/or blocked by Members of Parliament.

attributes.action: Introduce independent life skills In schools
attributes.background: We are a campaign called Lessons4Life, we are raising awareness that young people aren't being taught in school how to deal with real life situations (such as changing a fuse) We need your help to make a change !
attributes.additional_details: We carried out a survey which revealed that 93% of participants did not understand what a mortgage was. One survey participant stated ‘We aren’t taught these skills at all. I am about to go into year 10 and I have no clue how to pay tax or mortgage.’ This supports our campaign proposal and highlights that this issue needs to be made aware and eventually resolved.

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: Compel households to display a sign warning that there is a dog on the premises
attributes.background: Many people may call on a household on a daily basis for legitimate reasons and dog attacks are a significant hazard.  While the number of attacks has fallen after the change in legislation and greater understanding through dog awareness campaigns, it still remains unacceptably high.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, 2660 postmen/women were attacked by dogs in the last year some leading to a permanent disabling injury. As a postwoman myself I have had a dog bite, which fortunately wasn't serious, but have seen many colleagues that were not so lucky.

A simple sign at the entrance to a property and by the letterbox could help significantly. By making anyone calling at a house aware of the presence of a dog, they can take precautions to ensure their own safety and that of the dog living too.

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: To ban balloon releases to protect environment and wildlife
attributes.background: Mass balloon releases are causing a devastating impact on both the environment and wildlife on land and sea, there are many other ways to pay tribute to our loved ones without endangering our own wildlife and environments for example candlelight vigils, carol evenings, photo rememberances etc.
attributes.additional_details: Search YouTube, Google etc and see the devastating impact balloon releases have.

attributes.action: Make .22 Rimfire Pistols legal for Sporting purposes on FAC Certificates
attributes.background: In 1997 The UK Labour party Prime minister Tony Blair brought in The Firearm Ammendment Act of 1997 Number 2 which banned all .22 rimfire pistols for section 1 holders. I feel like the ban was unessecary and pointless and I feel that we have been treated as gulity people but we are not.
attributes.additional_details: Whoever holds a section 1 licence should have any gun they wish. Because what doesn't make sense is that if 22 rimfire semi auto rifles are legal then why can't we own a 22 rimfire pistol. If we somehow stand up against anti gun people and prove to them of how guns are not evil people that are bad are evil. If you even don't have a licence but support this sport you can push us to victory and freedom for this sport and live in a country with zero threat.

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Debate the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: ARM Holdings is a British success story, they design chip architecture for a vast proportion of the smartphones that we all use daily. Is this a good deal for the UK or just another highly leveraged sell off of a great company.

attributes.action: Make it a regulation that support staff have a decent bed when on sleep ins
attributes.background:
I have worked in the care sector for years now and have a spinal disc hernia and arthritis in my back.
This I'm sure is caused by unsuitable cheap beds that support staff sleep on several times a week, care staff are known to have back problems in later life cheap beds are a huge contribution.

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: Bring back national service
attributes.background: So the nation is ready for an unexpected attack or overseas war, also it would help to mold younger people to be more patriotic and proud of our great nation, it also teaches great life skills such as respect, team work, and patriotism and how to help ones self,
attributes.additional_details:
The older generation always say it should be brought back as it didn't do them any harm, 

also it would help against crime that the youth of today get involved in also the new threat of radicalization in the unhappy or troubled members of younger society the ones who think they are useless and have no calling in life, at least national service would unstil a sense of purpose,

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Care homes all fitted with cameras
attributes.background: If pubs need cameras to prevent violence, then why haven't care homes got them? Nothing to hide? Then fit cameras in all care homes now, ideally connected to wifi so that relatives can look in at any time. Obviously beds and bathrooms need to be exempt but accessible by audio.
attributes.additional_details:
A camera with sound in every home where carers visit would also be a good idea, linked via Wi - Fi to anyone requiring access. Nothing to hide? Then nothing to worry about. 
 With an average of £1000 a week the cameras will not event make a dent in profits. 
Sign up now...You may be the next one to be treated badly in care.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Hygiene Facilities in Educational Institutes for our Children
attributes.background: As a grandmother, I struggle at times as my grandchild comes home with her underwear unclean and parents and carers like me would like our children coming home clean and it would be easier for measures to put in place for hygiene purposes.

attributes.action: Redistribute 8 Billion saving from EU to areas with the highest unemployment.
attributes.background: If, we are to leave the EU, and the amount saved is 8 billion pounds. This money should not be swallowed up by tax cuts. It should go to alleviating poverty, in the areas that need it most.

attributes.action: Change UK Prostitution Laws to be in line with Norway, Sweden, Ireland, France.
attributes.background: The laws around prostitution in the UK are inefficient. Decriminalisation zones are proven to be ineffective, as demonstrated by the murder of Daria Pionko that took place in Leeds, December 2015. Laws around prostitution are in urgent need of reform to ensure this industry doesn't continue to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Signatories recommend:
- The prostituted be absolved of all criminality
- Investment is made in supporting prostituted persons to exit the sex trade via specialised training, support & health services
- Those at risk of entering prostitution are identified & supported to ensure they have viable career & education options
- The purchase of sexual access to human bodies is criminalised & subject to custodial penalty
- Consultation with Survivor Organisations is undertaken to inform legislation

attributes.action: British summer time should take effect at 4pm on a weekday
attributes.background: It is depressing losing an hours sleep and by changing it to an afternoon it would cheer everyone up, boosting public morale.

attributes.action: Parliament make a full and unequivocal apology for UK's part in invading Iraq
attributes.background: There is a case for parliament to make a full unequivocal apology for going to war with USA on Iraqi, killing so many of their people and our soldiers following the outcome of Chilcot Inquiry. Be sceptical about Trident submarine replacement and other military things USA may try to pull UK into.
attributes.additional_details:
USA simply went to war with an aim of "bomb back to the stone age" countries with things they wanted. Senior US spokes persons have admitted that the motive for invasion was because Saddam was seeking to raise the price of oil. Parliament used a lie to disguise its reasons. It is time to be somewhat sceptical about what USA expects of UK. 

Now is time to apologies.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to conduct racially insulting political campaign
attributes.background: It has become very common for politicians running for offices and campaigns lying and run racially insulting campaigns. Request the parliament to make it illegal to run such campaigns filled with lies and racial hatred
attributes.additional_details: The European Union referendum and the following Leaders elections have become very dirty. Many times the opponents blaming wrongly each other supporting certain religions. Using religion hatred is illegal in UK already, but no one is questioning the politicians when they are inciting the racial hatred. Request the parliamentarians to discuss this in the parliament and make laws to make racially motivated smear campaigns as illegal.

attributes.action: Re-commit £1 billion in funding for carbon capture and storage (CCS) technology.
attributes.background: Carbon capture and storage (CCS) takes the CO2 produced by power plants and locks it safely away underground. We need Government investment in this technology if the UK is to have any hope of meeting the carbon targets agreed in Paris 2015 and effectively fighting climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has been promising support for CCS since 2007, and in 2012 opened a commercialization "competition" offering £1 billion in venture capital. The funding was withdrawn in November 2015. 

The latest carbon budget will not enable us to meet Paris targets, but CCS can close the gap. The Energy and Climate Change committee and Oxford climate scientist Dr Myles Allen both recommend the Government develop a clear strategy for development of CCS infrastructure and expertise in the UK.

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of another A&E department in the North East...
attributes.background: Proposals would see A&E departments across Teesside, Durham and Darlington reduced from four to three; putting additional pressure on existing services.  Contradicting the Government’s pledge to ‘improve the health of the country’ and 'making services easier for patients to access'.
attributes.additional_details: The loss of local A&E Services in Hartlepool in 2011, has already caused unnecessary hardship and inconvenience for patients who now travel to Stockton to access A&E.  The road infrastructure (A19 / A66) is inadequate; causing delays for ambulances and patients, potentially causing unnecessary deaths.  The remaining four A&E Departments serve Hartlepool, Stockton, Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland and Darlington, with a total population of 662,800 (2011 Census).

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Scrap the compulsory roll out of Smart Meters by energy companies
attributes.background: Smart meters said to give total control of energy use & reduce bills is a ruse to introduce ‘time of day’ pricing tariffs. Designated peak times will impact low income, pensioners and increase bills. Energy companies will manipulate behaviour to their advantage with smart meters to spy on us.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Gov has done little to stop consumer exploitation. Smart meters infringe privacy & give risk of data security. Hackers could hijack the grid & cut off your supply.  Many EU countries reject smart meters. We don't need to comply with EU Directives for compulsory smart meters.   

UK Gov must scrap compulsory roll out – it’s costly, unlikely to change consumption habits, adversely affect low income/pensioners, is invasive & a security risk, restricting freedom to use energy when you need to.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: Lets Join The Nordic Alliance. Post Brexit
attributes.background: Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.
attributes.additional_details:
Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.

"When Britain leaves the EU, we will see a triangle that covers a large part of the globe: Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands, Norway - and now the United Kingdom,” said Iceland’s President Olafur Ragnar Grimsson

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to follow the policy of free trade globally
attributes.background: In this new age the UK needs to apply policies that reflect and encourage commerce throughout all nations and islands of the United Kingdom and to encourage this with all nations we trade with. This will show a willingness for free market economics to promote prosperity globally not just the UK.

attributes.action: Review how MPs are elected, can exercise power & standards they must adhere to.
attributes.background:
We seek government through consensus, with resources used to achieve our priorities: 
Access to healthcare & education based on need, not ability to pay.
Mental and physical health have equal status
Economic profitability is only a tool to facilitate the achievement of these priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs shall: 
-live and work in the constituency they represent
-use publicly available local education and health services.
-not receive any direct or indirect financial benefit other than their salary as an MP.
-not hold any office in any organisation during their tenure as MP, whether voluntary or paid.
-MPs income from investments, business or other interests shall be accumulated in a zero interest account. 
-not exercise any voting rights or other powers they may have over such funds.

attributes.action: Conscientious objection to military taxation
attributes.background: I no longer want to pay the percentage of taxes that are used to fund military budget. I feel that I am indirectly funding the killing of others. I am morally against this and no longer want to contribute to it through conscientious objection to military taxation.
attributes.additional_details: Conscientious objection to military tax is thought to be an extension to objection to military service. A person with a religious or ethical scruple against taking part in killing people during war is likely to feel no less scruple about paying somebody else to do the killing or about purchasing the mechanism of killing. If a government can respect the right of a person not to participate directly in making war, can it also respect the right of the person to avoid this indirect participation.

attributes.action: If the UK is forced to leave the EU, the government should apply to rejoin it.
attributes.background:
On 23rd June the EU referendum returned a small majority in favour of the UK leaving the EU. As of yet it is still unclear whether or not Article 50 will be invoked and we actually have to leave.

Should the UK be forced to leave the EU then the government should begin proceedings to rejoin it.
